Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 43rd overall pick, by Boston (UBA) in 1964...
Traded from Boston (UBA) to Gashouse on 2/20/1964 (Going to GHG: 2B M. Foley. Going to PIL: 3B J. Fifield)...
Injured on 7/29/1964 with a Sore Shoulder, out for 6 days...
Traded from Gashouse to Longport on 4/14/1965 (Going to LP: 1B J. Fermin, P A. Mena, 3B M. Foley. Going to GHG: P W. Baratta)...
Had first career hit (triple) on 4/18/1966, off Kenneth Gay (GHG)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/6/1967, off Andrew Hutto (GHG)...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Second Base in 1971...
Traded from Longport to Boston (FBA) on 3/2/1973 (Going to LP: 1B P. Hidalgo, P R. Hardnett. Going to SHP: 2B M. Foley)...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1977...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1980...
Signed as a free agent by Penn on 2/17/1982 to a 2-year deal worth $750,000 per year...
Injured on 4/29/1983 with a Bruised Heel, out for 5 days...
